intro: Aidia acutipetala, commonly known as the sharp-leafed aidia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, elliptical leaves with a pointed tip. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small umbels, and are often fragrant. Aidia acutipetala is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
